Parsimony (with regards to the trade-off of many or few parameters in data fitting)

Parameter (from the Ancient Greek παρά, "para", meaning "beside, subsidiary" and μέτρον, "metron", meaning "measure") can be interpreted in mathematics, logic, linguistics, environmental science and other disciplines.
